thread.title: Stephen Colbert compares how Beyonce, 'person of color' Donald Trump celebrated Black History Month
thread.title_full: Stephen Colbert compares how Beyonce, 'person of color' Donald Trump celebrated Black History Month

author: Dan Snierson
title: Stephen Colbert compares how Beyonce, 'person of color' Donald Trump celebrated Black History Month
text:
Email NBC 
On Wednesday’s installment of The Late Show , Stephen Colbert examines how two of the most powerful individuals in the world marked the first day of Black History Month. 
“Today, Black History Month started the way they all should — with an announcement that Beyoncé is pregnant,” quipped the host, who after referencing her Instagram announcement that she was expecting twins , launched into a “Double Babies” version of “Single Ladies.” 
In contrast, Colbert noted that the new President, whom he referred to as “another prominent person of color,” held a press conference to “honor African-American luminaries like the two black people he knows, Ben Carson and Omarosa.” He also freeze-framed footage from the event, in which it appeared Trump extended his middle finger while touching his forehead, calling it “a strong message to the African-American community.” 
You can see Colbert celebrate the Beyoncé pregnancy and tweak Trump in the video below. Tonight! Beyoncé and the President have very different approaches to celebrating #BlackHistoryMonth . #LSSC pic.twitter.com/ogeKl1LD1M 
— The Late Show (@colbertlateshow) February 2, 2017 
The Late Show airs weeknights at 11:35 p.m. ET on CBS. Show Full Article
